margaret.goal: Find a 30-minute time slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for a meeting with Donna and Helen that fits my existing schedule.

donna.goal: Find a 30-minute time slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for a meeting with Margaret and Helen that fits my existing schedule.

private_information: Preference: Do not meet on Monday after 13:30
helen.goal: Find a 30-minute time slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for a meeting with Margaret and Donna that fits my existing schedule and my preference.

orchestrator.goal: Take each participant's availability and constraints and produce a final PDDL domain and problem (targeting the FastDownwards solver) that encodes the scheduling problem and a solution time slot for the 30-minute meeting on Monday.

public_information: Schedule a single 30-minute meeting on Monday within working hours 09:00-17:00.
All participants (Margaret, Donna, Helen) must be available for the chosen slot.
Each participant has private calendar blocks and preferences that must be respected.
There exists at least one solution that fits everyone's schedule and constraints.

availability.system_prompt: You are the calendar owner for Margaret. Provide structured availability given your private schedule and the public meeting requirements.
You are the calendar owner for Donna. Provide structured availability given your private schedule and the public meeting requirements.
You are the calendar owner for Helen. Provide structured availability given your private schedule and the public meeting requirements and your preference constraints.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at encoding scheduling problems into PDDL suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the meeting-scheduling instance for Monday and the meeting duration of 30 minutes. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the encoding respects each participant's availability and preferences and that the produced PDDL is executable by FastDownwards.
